description.narrative: (Kenya): MEASURE Evaluation (PIMA) improves monitoring & evaluation (M&E) capacity to collect, analyze and present data to inform planning and programming.Using FY2015 funds, this activity will:Review current National Reproductive Health (NRH) Strategy (2009-2015) and development of NRH strategy (2015-2018) -Maternal and neonatal death reviews/audits, dissemination and actions to prevent future occurrences-Data review and utilization of Reproductive, Maternal and Newborn Child Health scorecard and other appropriate tools. -Implementation of the revised national M&E plan and technical assistance to increase the capacity of the National Malaria Control Program M&E staff to ensure that data is used for decision making and program improvements-Strengthening of the malaria surveillance system at the county level by providing support for trainings to build capacity for surveillance, M&E, mentorship and reporting -Improvement of family planning unit's M&E capacity to collect, analyze and use data.

participating-org.narrative: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

title.narrative: MEASURE evaluation PIMA : report on the midterm review, September 2012-June 2015
